title.narrative: Soutien au suivi et à l'évaluation

description.narrative:
Fundación ARU, an independent non-profit think tank based in Bolivia and funded by the Think Tank Initiative (TTI), wants to evaluate the impact of its activities. This project will provide funds to evaluate: -Fundación ARU's evidence-based meetings (EBM), which are held to disseminate research and foster policy debate. The organization would like to evaluate whether the EBM have changed the characteristics of policy debates and policy recommendations made by participants.
-the impact of government social program evaluations that Fundación ARU has conducted. It will recruit experts to help develop methodologies to use the available data. The evaluation results will inform Fundación ARU's policy linkages strategy.
In April 2013, TTI organized a workshop to build on grantees' monitoring and evaluation (M&E) capacities. During the workshop, institutions developed and reviewed their M&E plans and strategies. Building on that workshop, TTI offered to support the implementation of M&E plans and strategies. Through a call for proposals, grantees were invited to present requests for support. This Fundación ARU project emerged from that call.
Other specific objectives include: -enhance monitoring and evaluation systems' design and implementation; -evaluate whether policy recommendations take evidence into account; -assess Fundación ARU's research contribution to public policies in Bolivia; and, -learn under which conditions research is likely to influence policy in Bolivia.
TTI provides two main types of support to participating think tanks: core funding and capacity development. TTI's capacity development program complements this funding by strengthening think tanks in three key areas: -research methods and quality; -policy engagement and communications; and, -organizational effectiveness.
This project responds to TTI grantees' expressed organizational development support needs in Latin America.
